page.title: 05The Water Around World's End
page.content: The local river, the river Pang, provides water for the occupants of our area. The Thames Water Authority pumps up millions of tonnes of water all the time, this is used in the Thames Valley. The reason it is pumped, is because the area is over a huge artesian well. The actual Pang, above ground, has less water than it used to have. In our area there are 2 windpumps (497768 and 483753). The water from some houses comes straight from under ground, as far as 350 feet. The lowering of the water table has just about ceased flooding except after a very bad winter. However in 1984 the Pang ceased flowing for several months. The river Pang also provides many beauty spots for tourists and water at hand.
